Text:
I made a video intro for the web [www.davidusandizaga.com][1] This is the result visiting the web from my laptop, firefox and mozilla: ![laptop][2] And this is the result from my desktop, firefox and mozilla: ![desktop][3] Video's background is completely white, and got no idea why on my desktop it is blue, and not on my laptop. I changed manually browser's width to make it the same my laptop's (maybe it could be loosing color properties when adjusting video's height to quite bigger heights than video's original height?) but background on video keeps blue. Here you have the original video: http://davidusandizaga.com/presen.mp4 And this is how it is inserted: HTML:
CSS: video{ opacity:0; } .background{ position:fixed; top:0px; left:0px; height:100%; width:auto; opacity:0.4; } Apart from creating the other two video formats needed (its pending), and setting an image in case video is not loaded, you see any other bad practice in here? [1]: http://www.davidusandizaga.com [2]: http://i.stack.imgur.com/Winev.jpg [3]: http://i.stack.imgur.com/oR6RG.jpg
